snippet: A computer security company wanted to see how many people working in companies that run the nation's critical infrastructure would respond to an e-mail that could potentially introduce malware into their computer. The hit rate was enough to make you...
abstract: A computer security company wanted to see how many people working in companies that run the nation's critical infrastructure would respond to an e-mail that could potentially introduce malware into their computer. The hit rate was enough to make you shudder.

headline.main: Critical Infrastructure Systems Seen as Vulnerable to Attack
headline.print_headline:
Critical Systems
Called Vulnerable
To E-Mail Tricks
